alert.note: Alert for Inland Collier County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 11:10PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Collier County through 1145 PM EDT... At 1110 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud near Royal Palm Hammock, or 10 miles south of Golden Gate Estates, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds, winds in excess of 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fakahatchee Strand State Preserve, Picayune Strand State Forest, South Blocks Golde and Intersection I-75 And Everglades Blvd. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes.
